name: FS-37 Ravager
description: Contains many small pockets, allowing the user to evenly distribute weight of ammunition sample, and cool rocks.

name: FS-55 Devastator
description: Contains many small pockets, allowing the user to evenly distribute the weight of ammunition, samples and cool rocks.

name: CW-4 Arctic Ranger
description: Features a utility belt with pockets that can be filled with any number of things, such as pocket knives, mementos from home, and interesting rocks.

name: CW-22 Kodiak
description: The CW-22 Kodiak armor was thoroughly pressure-tested by patriotic volunteers, as part of the "Test Subjects for Super-Earth" Citizen Advancement Program.

name: SA-25 Steel Trooper
description: For optimal performance, the manufacturer recommends avoiding immersing this armor in salt water for prolonged periods.

name: SA-12 Servo Assisted
description: Each servo-assisted limb contains 138 miniature motors, to support a natural gait and long-term spinal health.

name: SA-32 Dynamo
description: In mountainous colonies, domestic variants of this armore are used to throw weather monitoring equipment uphill.

name: CE-74 Breaker
description: A domestic version of this armor is available for citizens who wish to perform efficient home renovation projects.

name: DP-00 Tactical
description: This classic armor set is recognized by every citizen: worn by the heroic Helldivers who battled and forever defeated the Terminids, Cyborgs, and Illuminate in the First Galactic War.

name: CE-35 Trench Engineer
description: After colonists of Hellmire recovered a lost shipment of this armor, the local pastime of fence-smashing was born.

name: CE-67 Titan
description: A quality product, this armor can destroy over 300,000 kilometers of fencing with no decline in operational efficiency.

name: CE-27 Ground Breaker
description: "The ground is just another obstable that hasn't yet been cleared." - SGM Janet Jones, Excavation Corps Founder

name: CM-09 Bonesnapper
description: Based on a colonial surgeon's gown, where surgeries were often interrupted by a need to perform defensive duties.

name: CM-21 Trench Paramedic
description: The suit was once designed to hold a variety of battlefield medical equipment. Now it holds a generous supply of stims.

name: CM-17 Butcher
description: An armor often worn by frontline surgeons, who are skilled at both putting bodies back together and taking them apart.

name: CM-10 Clinician
description: Featuring patented reverse-seam technology, to reduce the likelihood of bodily fluids entering the armor's interior.

name: B-22 Model Citizen
description: Gifted to Helldivers whose civilian lives were distinguished by exemplary citizenship, patriotism, and service to the Federation.

name: FS-61 Dreadnought
description: With genuine gold accents, 74% of colonists voted this armor the set they would most like to be buried in.

name: CE-07 Demolition Specialist
description: Originally worn by lunar terraformers, this suit can withstand rapid changes in preasure, heat, and personal velocity.

name: SC-15 Drone Master
description: Some soldiers report picking up strange radio interference when wearing this armor near alien artifacts.

name: FS-38 Eradicator
description: First deployed in the minds of Cyberstan, where it offered protection against explosions in the hydrogen-rich caverns.

name: EX-03 Prototype 3
description: Because this prototype's wire operates at 400,000 volts, it also includes a handy rubber underlayer for insulation.

name: EX-16 Prototype 16
description: As the electric arc generates a strong magnetic field, wearers should avoid use while in vinicity of stapled paperwork.

name: FS-34 Exterminator
description: Features a patented non-stick coating, which makes scraping viscera off after a long day of battle less taxing.

name: DP-40 Hero of the Federation
description: Though originally indended solely for ceremonial use, its inspirational energy proved equally useful on the battlefield.

name: DP-11 Champion of the People
description: The three stripes on the pauldrons stand for the three principles of Super Earth: Liberty, Democracy, and Prosperity.

name: CM-14 Physician
description: The distinctive red, white, and green of the Intergalactic Medical Corps signals to all Helldivers that help is at hand.

name: TR-117 Alpha Commander
description: For warriors who are so strong and confident that they don't need any reassurance whatsoever.

name: B-27 Fortified Commando
description: This armor set first appeared in the music video for the summer anthem 'Out Love is Like Liberty (Indestructible)'.

name: EX-00 Prototype X
description: The end result of several billion Super Credits and 12 years of research into creating "the Soldier of Tomorrow."

name: CE-81 Juggernaut
description: One of the most durable engineer armors available, each set is quality tested by an impact with a full-grown Charger.

name: SC-37 Legionnaire
description: This armor is based on the antique uniforms of the ‘Super Earth Legion’, a less patriotic precursor to the Helldivers.

name: B-08 Light Gunner
description: Compact and flexible, this kevlar armor adds minimal mass, making it a common choice for Helldiver fitness tests.

name: SC-30 TrailBlazer Scout
description: The patented fabric absorbs visible, infrared, and ultraviolet radiation, to prevent detection by all known species.

name: B-24 Enforcer
description: In field tests, 84% of users said that the armor improved their posture and self-esteem.

name: FS-05 Marksman
description: While early prototypes used shock-absorbing gels, this armor stabilizes aim with the use of internal gyroscopes.

name: FS-11 Executioner
description: Popularized by actor Chip Messiter, who wore this in the action-rom-com-musical "Lost My Heart to a Man in a Helmet".

name: SC-34 Infiltrator
description: This suit's plutonium-238 nuclear battery enables environmental scanning long after the user has ceased operation.

name: B-01 Tactical v1
description: This armor is the Super Earch Standard Issue, made from the same titanium alloy as the Destroyer's hull.

name: B-01 Tactical v2
description: This armor is the Super Earch Standard Issue, made from the same titanium alloy as the Destroyer's hull.

name: B-01 Tactical v3
description: This armor is the Super Earch Standard Issue, made from the same titanium alloy as the Destroyer's hull.

name: B-01 Tactical v4
description: This armor is the Super Earch Standard Issue, made from the same titanium alloy as the Destroyer's hull.

name: TR-40 Gold Eagle
description: This high-visibility armor allows its bearer to be easily seen through smoke, fog, and spewing viscera.

name: AF-52 Lockdown
description: Heavily layered to protect against ocular blistering, subdermal liquification, and gastrointestinal shattering, this armor is a testament to the power of iterative improvements based on user feedback.

name: AF-91 Field Chemist
description: This armor, together with its friendly-faced helmet, is instantly recognizable from the beloved children's show "Jen Shriver the Science Diver."

name: UF-84 Doubt Killer
description: Even among the most depraved of dissidents, the mere sight of this armor is enough to inspire a change of heart.

name: SR-64 Cinderblock
description: This armor uses repurposed metal from verified sources, such as vending machine packaging and Automaton scrap, making it a sustainable choice for the environmentally conscious Helldiver.

name: IE-57 Hell-bent
description: Assembled from pieces of recovered Helldiver armor and SEAF gear, for those who won't let a lack of full-body protection keep them from the battlefront.

name: GS-11
description: A the edge of the Federation, sometimes Democracy has only one representative.

name: CW-9 White Wolf
description: Featuring patented reverse-seam technology, to reduce the likelihood of bodily fluids entering the armor's interior.

name: CE-64 Grenadier
description: The set's classic advertising campaign "Have you tried a grenade?" has remained unchanged for over 70 years.

name: PH-56 Jaguar
description: "Prowl like a jaguar, strike like a viper." –Motto of the storied SEAF special operations unit whose real exploits were portrayed in the classic comic book series "Tales of the Viper Commandos."

name: CE-101 Guerilla Gorilla
description: Heavily insulated from animal bites, enemy fire, and the histrionic diatribes of anarchists.

name: I-44 Salamander
description: The signature orange pauldron allows easy battlefield detection of the bearer, alive or dead, on ash-strewn battlefields.

name: I-92 Fire Fighter
description: The heavy rubber tunic and reflective limb guards, originally designed to save citizens from burning buildings, now enable the liberal application of the cleansing fires of Justice.

name: SA-04 Combat Technician
description: Due to the enhanced strength caused by this armor, caution is advised when using door handles or embracing colleagues.

name: AF-50 Noxious Ranger
description: "We fear not poison, fear not death; spite our foes with every breath." From the beloved classic Hazard Pay: The Musical.

name: AF-02 Haz-Master
description: Developed by the Ministry of Science while investigating the phenomenon known as The Gloom, this armor is non-permeable and squeak resistant.

name: UF-50 Bloodhound
description: Users are advised not to scratch at the lacquer, as the Red 20,000 pigment that gives this armor its signature sheen may be correlated with rapid DNA unspooling.

name: UF-16 Inspector
description: Made famous by the “Truth Enforcers: Enforcers of Truth” mystery novels, this armor calls to mind those paragons of patriotism who protect us from treasonous lies.

name: SR-24 Street Scout
description: This armor's nostalgic color scheme brings to mind beloved trappings of colonial yesteryear: concrete frontier domiciles, slate-colored civilian jumpsuits, and Space Settlers' Pie.

name: SR-18 Roadblock
description: The crest on this armor's shoulder shows friendlies that safety is near, and foes that they have reach the end of the road.

name: IE-3 Martyr
description: Modeled after the Statue of Mournful Liberty, who weeps over the existence of tyranny, this armor is worn by those who would give their lives to dry her tears.

name: IE-12 Righteous
description: Modeled after the myriad Statues of Judicious Liberty, who keep a watchful eye on checkout lines, schoolyards, perpetual rehabilitation communities, and public confession theaters.

name: GS-17 Frontier Marshal
description: Inspired by the trailblazing agents of Super Earth Terraforming Company. These rugged adventurers surveyed hostile new planets during the post-GW1 Great Expansion era, preparing the untamed frontier for rapid and efficient assimilation.

name: GS-66 Lawmaker
description: Embodies the ethos of Manifest Democracy-that it is our voter-given responsibility to emancipate the savage, un-Liberated galaxy. To rest only when every planet is safe, civilized, and Free.

name: PH-9 Predator
description: Based on the uniform of Jackle 6, a veteran of the Viper Commandos who held off an entire Terminid brood on Nublaria in the First Galactic War with nothing but a machine gun, pocket knife, and Orbital Laser Strikes.

name: PH-202 Twigsnapper
description: The omission of upper-limb coverings allows for optimized freedom of movement, perspiration, and communication of upper body strength to squadmates.

name: I-09 Heatseeker
description: The burnished blood-red plates are forged in righteous fire, like the heroes they were wrought to protect.

name: I-102 Draconaught
description: Completely sheathed in 14-cm silica fiber foam, except for a thin tube to the ear canal to enable hearing the satifying screeches of Freedom's enemies as they burn.

name: AC-1 Dutiful
description: The breathing apparatus built into this armor helps both soldiers and colonists thrive, even when assigned to planets with atmospheres rated "suboptimal," "extreme," and "character building."

name: AC-2 Obedient
description: The helmet is equipped with a heptafocal specialty lenses, making it a favorite among long-distance snipers and micro-sculpture enthusiasts alike.

name: FS-23 Battle Master
description: This aim-stabalizing armor found suprising secondary market success among alien birdwatching enthusiasts.

name: CW-Winter Warrior
description: Offering camouflage in snowy environements, surplus sets of this armor are used by nature photographers and keen hunters alike.

name: DP-53 Savior of the Free
description: A faithful replica of the armor worn at The Battle of Liberty Peak. Honor their legacy, and wear it with pride.

name: TR-7 Ambassador of the Brand
description: Promotional armor made by SUMY Corp. as part of a highly successful marketing campaign for frozen yogurt.

name: AD-26 Bleeding Edge
description: Pushing the boundaries of bionic engineering, this armor collects and dispenses a number of vital fluids, several of which are soon to be declassified.

name: AD-49 Apollonian
description: Equipped with the latest computational systems, subsystems, and supersystems, this armor is worth the equivalent of a small Megacity.
